definition: hammer/to hammer into shape/weight (e.g. of a steelyard or balance)/to strike with a hammer
lit. to fix the tone with a single hammer blow/fig. to make the final decision
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
a one-off, short-sighted deal/a one-shot, all-out attempt
malleus or hammer bone of middle ear

sentences.english: A powerful melon hammer with six arrises in Ming dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 挺有打击力度的明代六棱瓜锤。

sentences.english: We are like jewels, shaped with the hammer and chisel of adversity.
sentences.chinese: 我们有如宝石，需要经过苦难的锤凿来雕琢。

sentences.english: Rotor is an important assembly of hammer mill.
sentences.chinese: 转子是锤片式粉碎机的主要工作部件。

sentences.english: The buds and branches shall be of one piece with the lampstand, hammered out of pure gold.
sentences.chinese: 球和枝子要接连一块，都是一块精金锤出来的。

sentences.english: It also has separate firing pin that was operated by hammer.
sentences.chinese: 它还具有独立的撞针，是由锤经营。

sentences.english: The cast steel and high chromium cast iron were used respectively as handle and head of the hammer.
sentences.chinese: 分别采用高铬铸铁和碳素钢作为锤端和锤柄。

sentences.english: The workers kneel on the ground and hammer the small stones in.
sentences.chinese: 工人们跪在地上，将小石子锤进去。

sentences.english: Taketo enforcement of such grip hammer Ji, zoned air-strike case, impassioned.
sentences.chinese: 武人执之如握锤戟，划空击案，慷慨激昂。

sentences.english: This paper discusses the procedures of DTH hammer and core drilling with casing.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要论述了空气潜孔锤跟管取心钻进规程。

sentences.english: Used with our down-hole hammer, it can drill through complicated formations in which drilling holes are easy to collapse.
sentences.chinese: 配合我厂生产的潜孔锤，可以钻穿复杂，易坍塌底层。

sentences.english: Maybe his recent saltwater dunking and ice encrustation had caused a problem in the MJOLNIR system.
sentences.chinese: 或许是近期的盐水浸泡和冰冻使雷神锤盔甲出了问题。

sentences.english: The relation between property of hammer crusher and property of separation and breaking was studied.
sentences.chinese: 锤片式粉碎机的设计参数对脱胚破碎指标的影响很大。

sentences.english: The upraised hammer dropped from his hands.
sentences.chinese: 高举的锤从他的手中落下来。

sentences.english: In this paper the attention is paid to study the soil-related factors affect the vibro-driveability.
sentences.chinese: 本文对影响振动桩锤沉桩能力的土力因素进行了研究。

sentences.english: I hit my thumb twice while pounding in the nail for the picture.
sentences.chinese: 因为这幅挂画，在锤钉子时，我两次锤到自己在拇指。

sentences.english: I hit my thumb twice while pounding in the nail for the picture.
sentences.chinese: 因为这幅挂画，在锤钉子时，我两次锤到自己在拇指。

definition: to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
(neologism c. 2017) (slang) to demand proof of what one believes to be an unfounded accusation only to have irrefutable evidence duly supplied
to smash/to pound/to fail/to muck up/to bungle
